poem:
Title: "In the Thicket of Innocence Lost"

In the wildwood of boyhood, four wolves held court,
Where jests and jeers turned acrid, a vile sport.
In shadows, cornered, a lamb lost his fight,
Handed innocence to wolves under fluorescent light.
A silent scream echoes within cold, cruel walls,
While masked in classrooms, the brave facade falls.
Yet, from the bitter dark, may emerge a light-
Billy remembers, Billy resists, Billy takes flight.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. The group would corner him in the toilets and grope and touch his genitals. Unsurprisingly, Billy’s mental". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
